name: Air Fryer Coconut Chicken
author: Yoly
summary: These coconut-panko crusted chicken strips are crispy, crunchy, and oil-free. The chicken strips are double dipped in egg and in the coconut-panko mixture to ensure crispiness. Cooked in an air fryer they are ready in just a few minutes. They are moist and tender on the inside. Serve with or without your choice of dipping sauce.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips
directions: Place coconut milk, pineapple juice, brown sugar, soy sauce, Sriracha sauce, and ginger in a medium sized bowl and whisk to combine
Add chicken strips and toss to coat
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight
Preheat an air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine shredded coconut, panko, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl
Remove chicken strips from the marinade and shake off excess
Dip chicken strips in beaten egg, then in coconut-panko mixture, then again in egg mixture, and again in coconut-panko mixture, double dipping and double coating each strip
Spray the air fryer basket with cooking spray
Place breaded chicken strips in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching; work in batches if necessary
Cook for 6 minutes, flip strips, and continue cooking until lightly browned and toasted, 4 to 6 minutes more
